Svar_1: I have chosen this case with Region Dalarna because it focuses on building a practical and scalable solution in a real organizational and healthcare environment. The project addresses a clear need to improve access to data and decision support, and involves designing reliable systems based on existing data models. This case is interesting because it provides hands-on experience with data-driven systems, system integration, and understanding organizational requirements within the healthcare sector. It also allows close alignment with real user needs and workflows in a public organization. Overall, this case offers a structured and meaningful project with clear relevance, making it a strong and suitable choice.
Svar_2: I have chosen this case with Triona because it focuses on developing a practical and reliable system in a real business environment. The project addresses a clear need for automated data collection and supports efficient collaboration between distributed systems. This case is interesting as it involves backend and full-stack development, API-based communication, and system reliability aspects such as buffering, logging, and monitoring. It also emphasizes building robust and scalable solutions that are important for successful system adoption in enterprise environments. Overall, this case represents a well-defined and manageable project that complements my first choice by offering a more technically focused and industry-oriented perspective.
Svar_3: I have chosen this case with Sogeti because it focuses on developing a practical system that supports everyday collaboration in a hybrid work environment. The project has clear goals and allows flexibility in choosing technical solutions, which makes it suitable for efficient teamwork. This case is interesting as it involves full-stack development, real-time data handling, and user-focused design. It also emphasizes usability and simplicity, which are important factors for successful system adoption in organizations. Overall, this case represents a well-defined and manageable project that complements my first and second choices by offering a more application- and UX-oriented perspective.
Svar_4: *]:pointer-events-auto scroll-mt-[calc(var(--header-height)+min(200px,max(70px,20svh)))]"> Yes, I would prefer to work with Ubah Abdullahi, Ilhan Ahmed Nur, and Rayan Noor Ahmed. The four of us have worked together since the beginning of the program, which has allowed us to build a strong understanding of each other’s working styles, strengths, and responsibilities. Over time, we have developed clear and effective communication, which helps us collaborate efficiently and resolve issues quickly. We also all have part-time jobs alongside our studies. Because of this, we are very good at coordinating our schedules and adapting our study and project times when needed. Our flexibility and mutual respect make it easier to plan meetings, distribute tasks fairly, and maintain steady progress throughout a project. Working together, we have proven that we can stay organized, support each other, and deliver results even when schedules vary. For these reasons, I strongly believe that we would function as a well-balanced and reliable project group.
Svar_5: No, there is no one in particular that I do not want to work with. I have mainly worked with the same group of people throughout my studies, and those collaborations have worked well.

Svar_1: My first choice is Case No. 1: Data-agent for conversational access to healthcare analytics (Region Dalarna). I currently work within Region Dalarna, which gives me practical insight into how decision-makers access and use information in everyday operations. This case is therefore highly relevant to my professional context and directly connected to my planned bachelor’s thesis, which focuses on governance, decision-making capacity, and the gap between formal requirements and practical execution in public organizations. The core challenge in this case is not the lack of data, but the difficulty of translating existing analytical resources into timely, usable decision support. This mirrors the focus of my thesis, where I study how organizational structures and decision rights affect the ability to act under time pressure. Working with this case allows me to explore how information systems can strengthen organizational decision-making and governance in a real public-sector environment.
Svar_2: My second choice is Case No. 11: TRACS Flow Data Collector – Automated usage data collection (Triona AB). This case complements my planned bachelor’s thesis by focusing on system-level oversight, monitoring, and organizational control of complex information systems. Collecting reliable usage data across distributed customer environments is essential for informed decision-making, governance, and accountability. The case provides hands-on experience with enterprise systems and illustrates how technical infrastructure enables organizational visibility and strategic decision-making. This perspective is highly relevant to my interest in how organizations create the prerequisites for informed decisions rather than focusing solely on operational details. The industrial context also strengthens my understanding of governance challenges beyond the public sector.
Svar_3: My third choice is Case No. 4: Office presence tracking system (Sogeti). This case relates to my academic interest in transparency, responsibility, and coordination in organizations. Designing a system that visualizes presence and availability raises important governance questions about how information supports managerial oversight and everyday decision-making. From a system science perspective, the case allows me to analyze how digital systems shape organizational behavior and accountability. This connects well to my bachelor’s thesis, which examines how formal structures and expectations are translated into practical organizational capacity.
Svar_4: Kawsar Adullahi, Ilhan Ahmed Nur & Rayan Noor Ahmed Yes, I would prefer to work with the same group members I have worked with over the past two years. We are used to working together, communicate well, and have similar work schedules alongside our studies. This makes it easier for us to plan meetings, coordinate tasks, and work efficiently throughout the project.
Svar_5: No, there is no one I specifically do not want to work with.

Svar_1: Fall 3. Digitalt escape room baserat på Trafikverket IKT-information Det lockade mig eftersom det är ett kreativt projekt där man får ta information och göra den mer levande och lätt att förstå. Jag tycker om att arbeta med lösningar som är enkla för användaren men bygger på tydlig struktur i bakgrunden. Ett digitalt escape room känns som ett roligt och annorlunda sätt att sprida information och jag motiveras av att få vara med och skapa något som faktiskt används vid mässor och event.
Svar_2: Fall nr 4: System för spårning av kontorsnärvaro Det intresserar mig eftersom det handlar om ett tydligt behov i arbetslivet. Jag tycker det är spännande att få vara med och föreslå hur en teknisk lösning kan se ut och att arbeta med system som ska fungera i vardagen för många användare. Närvaro, flexibilitet och smarta digitala lösningar är något som känns väldigt aktuellt idag.
Svar_3: Fall nr 11: TRACS Flow Data Collector – Automatiserad insamling av användningsdata. Det lockade mig eftersom det handlar om hur system pratar med varandra via API och hur man hanterar fel och drift på ett bra sätt. Jag tror att detta projekt ger bra erfarenhet inför arbetslivet.
Svar_4: Ja, Adrian Nasrat, maddelene Stenberg, Linn bellskog, Jonathan Jonsson, Vehid, Malin Gustavsson, Diana Dawidi, Tesmin Omran
Svar_5: Mhmoud Ahmad, Yue Li, Yujia Luo, Xiaotong Li, Nengxi Peng, Peng Wu, Ruyang Yao

Svar_1: Case No 3: Digital escape room. Motivation: Jag kommer genomföra mitt examensarbete på Trafikverket och ser det som en potentiell framtida arbetsplats då Trafikverket har mycket som jag söker hos en arbetsgivare. Utöver det så tyckte jag att deras presentation var intressant, jag upplevde deras case som lekfullt och kreativt vilket passar mig som person då jag brinner för kreativitet och att få använda fantasin. Möjligheten att vara kreativ inom detta område var anledningen till att jag från start sökte till programmet.
Svar_2: Case No 4: Office presence tracking system. Motivation: Jag har kontakter inom detta företag och jag kan se hur detta case skulle vara användbart för deras anställda vilket också bidrar till att jag känner mig motiverat till att delta i detta case. Då många inte sitter på kontoret dagligen utan också arbetar hemifrån så kan det vara givande att veta vilka som befinner sig på kontoret. Jag uppskattar också att det finns lite utrymme för hur detta ska genomföras vilket tillåter oss att komma med ideér gällande hur det eventuellt ska utformas.
Svar_3: Case No 2: Digital consent solution for use of photos and media. Motivation: Presentationen var väldigt stark, med tydliga instruktioner. Det fyller ett tydligt syfte och jag tror att det kan vara användbart för flera andra företag att ha liknande lösningar.
Svar_4: Madelene Stenberg, Jonathan Jansson, Vehid Sumic. Motivation: Jag och Madelene ska genomföra examensarbetet ihop. Jag har arbetat i grupp med Madelene och Jonathan, vi är alla föräldrar till småbarn vilket har varit till enorm hjälp på flera olika sätt. Delvis har vi samma tider och stor förståelse för vad det innebär att studera parallellt med småbarn (hämtningar från förskolor, lämningar, vabb). Jag upplever att dessa människor som jag skrivit ner främjer min utveckling genom att vi är ett team där inte dumma frågor finns och vi alla glädjs åt att se varandra utvecklas och förbättras samt att vi har en jämn arbetsfördelning.Jag har varit i grupper där personer inte dyker upp utan att meddela detta, varit i grupp där personer dumförklarat andra och jag hoppas att det inte representerar min framtida arbetsplats. Jag förstår att ni vill att vi ska utmana oss med att arbeta sida vid sida av olika individer men vi arbetar under många deadlines. Jag vet att dessa personer tar studierna på allvar för att få ett arbete, då vi inte endast studerar för oss själva utan också för vår familj.

Svar_1: Region dalarna, ser det som en relevant förstudie inför vårt kommande exjobb hos region gävleborg genom att bygga en djupare förståelse för hur analytiska datamodeller kan göras mer tillgängliga för chefer och medarbetare.
Svar_2: Sogeti. Jag uppskattar att uppdraget ger oss frihet att föreslå tekniska lösningar som ger möjligheten att arbeta med hela kedjan från behovsanalys till teknisk lösning. Möjligheten att integrera en lösning i ett befintligt system, exempelvis webb eller teams, låter både intressant och lärorik.
Svar_3: Borlänge kommun. Detta kan vara ett mycket intressant och relavant systemutvecklarprojekt, att utveckla en strukturerad och användarvänlig lösning som ger chefer en samlad bild av nuläget och samtidigt skapar en tydlighet för medarbetare kring ansvar och status.
Svar_4: Katarina Hedman

Svar_2: Case 2 is my second choice because it addresses a clear and practical problem with a well-defined scope. The solution is straightforward to prototype and allows us to demonstrate usability, security, and basic system design within a limited timeframe.

Svar_1: Mitt förstahandsval är att jobba med triona. Jag är nyfiken på Triona som företag och skulle tycka det var jättespännande att få lära känna dem som företag. När det kommer till deras pitch på projektidé tyckte ja det lät otroligt spännande. Av egna erfarenheter så gillar jag när man kan göra saker mer effektivt vilket det är det som triona vill med sin projektide, att faktiskt automatisera en del av sin verksamhet. Jag skulle mer än gärna vilja testa på ett sånt här case då jag tror att man kommer få med sig mycket erfarenhet och att man kommer stöta på liknande saker i sin yrkeskarriär där man kan ha nytta av det här projektet.
Svar_2: Mitt andraval är Borlänge Kommun. Samma här så gillar jag när man kan effektivisera för människor, fördela ansvar och ha tydlig struktur. Eftersom jag har jobbat inom hemtjänsten ligger detta såklart en varmt om hjärtat när det kommer till att skapa en trivsam miljö för arbetera som också leder till att kvaliteten hos de som behöver hjälp.
Svar_3: Mitt tredjeval är den som Sarah presenterade om att digitalisera consent forms. Det känns både roligt men också läskigt med detta projekt, vilket gör att det blir mitt "sistahandsval".
Svar_4: Linnea Andersson, Kajsa-Stina Lagergren är de jag föredrar att jobba med, vi har tydliga strukturer, jobbar enbart dagtid och jobbar hårt. Jag skulle också kunna jobba med Linn Bellskog, Madelene Stenberg, Sebastian Hopstadius. Har inte jobbat med dessa tidigare men jag vet att de är drivna personer.
Svar_5: Det ABSOLUT viktigaste för mig är att inte hamna med en person som inte är driven, målmedveten och jobbar kvällar och helger. Angående sista frågan: No är om det inte är någon av mina tre val. Alltså mitt förstaval är inte viktigare än gruppkonstellationen.

Svar_1: Case 7 is my first choice because it offers a perfect balance between technical backend development and user-facing design. I am strongly motivated by the opportunity to turn a prototype into a secure, production-ready system that supports the local reindeer herding industry. I have a solid understanding of database management and system architecture, which is essential for implementing the required secure server-side storage. Additionally, I am keen to work on the UI to ensure it is intuitive for the herders. This project feels like the most meaningful way to apply my skills to a real-world problem.
Svar_2: Case 6 is my second choice because I am interested in the challenge of automating manual workflows. I have experience in analyzing business processes and modeling system logic, which makes me well-suited to determine how to robotize these student applications. I enjoy finding technical solutions to reduce administrative bottlenecks and improve efficiency for the university.
Svar_3: I selected Case 2 as my third choice because it addresses a clear need for digital transformation. I am interested in designing the database structure required to handle consent data securely and ensuring the system is professional and compliant. Building a user-friendly flow from a QR code to a backend database is a practical project that aligns well with my development skills.
Svar_4: Peng wu,Yujia Luo,Ruiyang Yao
Svar_5: I do not have any specific individuals I wish to avoid. However, since I am still learning Swedish and not yet fluent, I need to work in a group where the primary working language is English to ensure I can contribute effectively.

Svar_1: My first choice is Case No. 1: Data-agent for conversational access to healthcare analytics at Region Dalarna. I work within Region Dalarna, which gives me practical insight into how data and decision support are used in everyday operations. The case addresses a clear challenge: valuable analytics exist, but access to them is limited by technical and organizational barriers. This aligns well with my studies in information systems and my interest in improving decision-making through more accessible and user-friendly data solutions.
Svar_2: My second choice is Case No. 11: TRACS Flow Data Collector at Triona AB. This case is interesting because it focuses on large-scale enterprise systems and the challenges of collecting reliable usage data across multiple customer environments. The problem is not only technical, but also related to governance, coordination, and decision support. It fits well with my interest in information systems and how organizations use data to gain better control and insight, while also offering valuable exposure to professional system development in an industrial setting.
Svar_3: My third choice is Case No. 4: Office presence tracking system at Sogeti. This case is appealing because it addresses organizational transparency and coordination through digital systems. A presence tracking solution involves not only technical design, but also considerations related to trust, governance, and usability in the workplace. The case aligns with my interest in how information systems influence daily work practices and support coordination and decision-making in knowledge-based organizations.
Svar_4: Yes, I would prefer to work with the same group members I have collaborated with previously. Ubah Abdullahi, Kawsar Abdullahi, and Rayan Noor Ahmed. We have already developed effective ways of communicating, coordinating tasks, and working together, which has led to strong results in earlier courses. We also have similar schedules alongside our studies, making it easier to plan meetings and manage deadlines. Based on our experience, this group setup would support an efficient and well-organized project.
Svar_5: No, there is no one I specifically do not want to work with.

Svar_1: Case No 3. My first choice is the case at Trafikverket, focusing on the digitalization of security follow-up.I am highly motivated to work with this case because it combines digitalization, agile development and C#, which closely reflects how modern system development is carried out. The case is particularly meaningful to me as it addresses an important societal function and allows me to apply my skills in a real-world context. This makes the case not only highly interesting but also very well aligned with both my personal learning goals and the objectives of the course.
Svar_2: Case No 4. My second choice is the case at Sogeti.I want to work with this case because it is about building a useful and practical system that helps people in their daily work. Developing a real-time solution that improves overview and coordination is something I find very interesting. The case also fits well with the course, as it gives hands-on experience in system development and creating real value with digital solutions.
Svar_3: Case No 11. My third choice is the case at Triona AB, focusing on automated usage data collection for the TRACS Flow system.I want to work with this case because it involves designing a scalable and robust system with APIs, services, and monitoring, which is highly relevant to modern system development. The case provides practical experience with real-world challenges such as reliability, error handling and data modeling, and fits very well with the technical focus of the course.
Svar_4: Yes I prefer to work with Anna Backolars, Madelene Stenberg, Linn Bellskog, Vehid Sumic, Diana Dawidi, Tesnim Omran and Anton Wiberg.
Svar_5: I wouldn't like to work with Mhmoud Ahmad, Yue Li, Yujia Luo, Xiaotong Li, Nengxi Peng, Peng Wu and Ruyang Yao.

Svar_1: Trafikverket (Preferably Case 2). I work 10 hours per week at trafikverket as a student "Systemvetare" along with Anton Wiberg, and we are also going to be writing our thesis there.
Svar_2: Triona. This case sounds very interesting, doable and also very scaleable. I believe i can contribute to not only delivering the must haves but i also discussed how to expand the scope with them, should our timeframe allow it.
Svar_3: Region Dalarnas AI implementation to their database. This is a very interesting and modern problem. I believe i am particularly well suited to taking on this case since i have played around a lot with AI solutions in my spare time and i have also gotten certified in AI900 from Azure.
Svar_4: Anton Wiberg and I would really appreciate it if we could be placed in a group together. We function very well in a team and since we are going to write our thesis togheter and we work together, in the same team and on the same project at Trafikverket it would work out very well for us. Planning our workweeks would be nearly impossible if we have to accomodate 2 different groups (up to 16 people in total).
Svar_5: I get along with everyone

Svar_1: Trafikverket, I'm interested in creativity and efficiency, which is fun because they arn't mutually exclusive either. The escape room case they brought up made me interested because I like when it comes to creativity, usually I'm very creative in a logical way where there require solutions, eg when it comes to programming. But doing a real life digital escape room will also challenge my creativity in making something FUN in a creative way rather than just finding a logical solution in a creative way. I'm also a studentmedarbetare there and will do my bachelor thesis, so I think it'd be a great way to potentially meet new future colleges, and get a better feel at how it's at Trafikverket, and for the first case they brought up how the escape room should include what kind of values Trafikverket holds which is something thats important for me, I believe it's a perfect match and will benefit both Trafikverket and I greatly :)I'm also interested in the second case, but I think that would challenge me less than the first case because I think just finding a solution to a problem to make it more efficent is where one of my expertise
Svar_2: Sogeti, I think what they want to have data on is very interesting, I've also went to their studentkvällar and I've gotten to know a few of them, I've had a few talks with Tobias and I appreciated his engagement in conversations, problems and solutions, and apparently one co-worker mentioned me to him after they saw a linkedin post I made and I was very flattered when I found out :) Their case seems interesting, perhaps not the most challenging tech-wise, but maybe it is? It's a bit up in the air and I think creativity will be a key factor here, which is something I'm very passionate about!
Svar_3: Triona AB, I think they actually have a VERY clear idea what they want, and it does look a bit challenging which makes it fun, and looks like the solution they want is something they'll actually use permamently. I think I should work with this because I'm a very straight forward to the solution type of person, very efficent and usually produce very strong results.
Svar_4: Madelene StenbergLinn BellskogJonathan Jansson

Svar_1: Case No 11: TRACS Flow Data Collector – Automated usage data collection This task sounds like a very solid case for a system that is in need of a modern storage and information facilitation solution. Working with cloud based solutions is something that is going to become much more common in the future, and I think that it's a good idea to start modernizing and implementing for that future!
Svar_2: Case No 4: Office presence tracking system I think this is sound like a very interesting feature to work on. It feels like a modern and seamless way to make contact with someone who might be at the office, without having to rely on scheduling through email which I know can be slow and tedious. I'd also be interesed in the result of an function or app like this in a work enviroment, too, beyond just the development of the app.
Svar_3: Case No 8: OAuth-based authentication for inventory system I have developed simple apps that sends HTTP request methods to a database but haven't had the opportunity to see how this architecture could be integrated with a authentication system. I think that going into a project like this is very important, not to mention good to learn!
Svar_4: Wabe Visser - h22wabvi@du.se
Svar_5: No

Svar_1: Case No 3: Digital escape room based on Trafikverket IKT information Jag skulle vilja arbeta med detta projekt dels för att jag ska göra mitt examensarbete hos Trafikverket, vilket innebär att detta hade kunnat vara en bra start på att lära mig mer om Trafikverket, deras system, miljöer, etc. Utöver detta så älskar jag logiska pussel och spel, så jag tror att jag skulle lyckas ta fram en riktigt kreativ, rolig och bra lösning åt dem!
Svar_2: Case No 4: Office presence tracking system Sogeti som företag lockar mitt intresse och projektet i sig låter väldigt intressant, särskilt då det handlar om att utveckla ett system där vi som studenter uppmanas att föreslå teknisk lösning själva. Detta får mig att tänka att det kommer innebära mycket kreativt tänkande och mycket problemlösning, vilket passar mig perfekt!
Svar_3: Case No 2: Digital consent solution for use of photos and media Detta låter väldigt intressant och något som jag tror att jag hanterar utan problem. Det låter som att en lösning på detta kan vara användbart hos de flesta företag, det hade därför varit väldigt kul att vara med och ta fram en riktigt bra lösning på detta!
Svar_4: Madelene Stenberg, Linn Bellskog, Vehid Sumic. Madelene Stenberg och Linn Bellskog då jag och dom har väldigt liknande förutsättningar och tider då vi kan studera, då vi alla tre har barn. Det förenklar grupparbetet väldigt mycket att just ha gemensamma tider som passar alla, samt hur det kan "gå till" när man har små barn. Vi arbetar dessutom väldigt bra ihop. Vehid Sumic då han är väldigt ambitiös, duktig, passar bra in i gruppen och är även han tillgänglig de tider vi andra kan.

Svar_1: Mina önskemål: 1. Case No 3: Digital escape room based on Trafikverket IKT information. Jag har gjort ett icke-digitalt escaperoom på mitt jobb tidigare ( i utbildningssyfte för alla i åk 4 i borlänge) och tyckte det var otroligt roligt och givande. Jag kommer också göra examensarbete där. (Och trafikverket behöver fler utvecklare som är tjejer). Jag älskar problemlösning och kluringar, och helt ärligt är jag en jäkel på att brain-storma ideér, jag hade passat riktigt bra här. Den tekniska biten är nog jätterolig och utmanande, (jag har varit med i ett team som utvecklat en app tidigare, dock var jag inte utvecklare utan satt på ideérna för att locka barn att lära sig, men gamification är roligt).
Svar_2: 2. Case No 4: Office presence tracking system. Detta case känns som ett system som flera företag skulle ha intresse i (flera har det säkert redan), men denna känns extra rolig då det går att koppla till hålbarhet såsom om alla enheter som finns på kontoret verkligen behövs, är det "onödiga" resor till coh från kontoret. Det kanske går att koppla till välmående, blev många bekväma hemmasittare efter covid- och hur tar man sig ur vanan? Mår man bra hemma i ensamheten eller är det läskigt att ta sig tillbaka? osv. Det finns nog mycket spännande att disskutera med Sogeti om varför de vill ha ett sådant system. Tekniskt sett tror jag detta case
Svar_3: 3. Case No 2: Digital consent solution for use of photos and media. Jag har själv upplevt detta problem i mitt arbete och hade uppskattat en bra lösning. Därmed tror jag att jag har bra insikt i hur jag själv hade velat se en lösning. Tekniskt känns det lagomt utmanande samtidigt som vi hade fått sätta våra befintliga kunskaper på prov!
Svar_4: Linn Bellskog Vehid Sumic Jonathan Jansson Jag och Linn ska skriva examensarbete för trafikverket ihop så det vore bra att få börja ett projekt redan nu och bli varma i kläderna. Vi har hittat arbetssätt som passar oss och driver fram varandras bästa motivationer, vi vet hur vi fungerar och läser av varandra utan att behöva fråga. I ett team tycker jag det är viktigt att kunna vara så bekväma. Jag går väldigt bra ihop med Vehid, vi har inte jobbat i samma skolgrupp tidigare men funkar mycket bra som ett team, vi kompletterar varandra väldigt bra socialt-tekniskt-projektledarigt och vi motiverar varandra i arbeten för att plocka fram varandras styrkor. Jag och Linn har varit i grupp ihop med jonathan tidigare vilket har fungerat jättebra, vi puschar varandra i rätt riktning och kan lita på varandra när vi delar upp arbeten! Alla fyra ska skriva examensarbete på trafikverket, och vi hade som grupp gjort ett sjudundrande bra jobb. Vi kompletterar varandra jättebra med kompetenser och intresseområden inom arbeten, högskolan hade varit stolta över att skicka oss till trafikverket! Allihopa är såklart mottagliga för fler gruppkamrater, vi är öppna personer som kommer låta alla vara med och få ta sin plats.
Svar_5: Kristin Snibb.

Svar_1: Det första caset som jag skulle vilja arbeta med är Case 4, eftersom det är ett verkligt och praktiskt problem som företag faktiskt behöver lösa.
Svar_2: Det andra caset som jag skulle vilja arbeta med är Case 2, eftersom det löser ett verkligt och relevant problem genom att ersätta pappersbaserade samtycken med en säker och användarvänlig digital lösning.

Svar_1: Digital consent solution for Dalarna University. This case is interesting because it addresses a real and concrete problem. At the moment, the university handles consent using paper forms, which makes the process slow, inefficient, and outdated. A digital solution would make it easier for both students and staff and improve the overall workflow. The scope of the project also feels clear and manageable. The requirements are not vague, which makes it possible to plan the work properly and build the system step by step. It is also a good opportunity to work with a complete web application, including frontend, backend, and database. This case also connects well to important skills for working life, such as building full solutions from start to finish, focusing on usability, and handling sensitive data securely.
Svar_2: Automation of student leave of absence applications. This case is appealing because it focuses more on analysis and investigation than just development. The goal is to understand the current process, consider legal and administrative requirements, and suggest how automation could be implemented. This makes the assignment more about improving a system than building one completely. There is also a clear benefit to this work, since they have more than 200 cases handled manually every year. If parts of the process can be automated, it could save staff a lot of time and make case handling more efficient. The project also feels flexible and realistic, since the outcome can be a structured report and recommendations rather than a full technical implementation.
Svar_3: OAuth-based authentication for Protoduck. This case is smaller and very clearly defined. The system already exists, and the main task is to add secure login so it can be used online safely. That makes the work focused and easy to plan, since it is clear what needs to be delivered. Even though this case is more development-heavy than the second one, the scope is limited to one specific feature instead of building a complete system. It is also useful experience since OAuth is widely used in many modern applications.
Svar_4: Yes, I would prefer to work with Lawin Akgül and Kendal Acun. The main reason is practical. Our schedules match well, which makes it easier to meet and collaborate. Since we all have work and other responsibilities outside university, having similar availability makes a big difference. In earlier group projects, planning meetings was often the biggest challenge and sometimes slowed down progress. Working with Lawin and Kendal would make coordination smoother and help the group stay productive.
Svar_5: No.

Svar_1: Case No 11: TRACS Flow Data Collector – Automated usage data collectionI like the fact that we will have a product owner and architect which really simulates real-life when we get out in the real world. Secondly I also find it interesting that it is until now being manually solved and I really want to be apart of the process to achieving automation and I have also always liked working with cloud-based solutions.
Svar_2: Case No 4: Office presence tracking system I choose Case 4 second because it is a clear, practical need and can be delivered as a simple system with real-time visibility. It also gives freedom to choose the technical solution (app/web/Teams) and build a complete end-to-end product.
Svar_3: Case No 8: OAuth-based authentication for inventory system I choose Case 8 third because adding OAuth is necessary to host the system securely online. It is a focused task with a modern stack (ASP.NET, PostgreSQL, Docker) and gives valuable experience in authentication and security.
Svar_4: Vahid Sumic, Wabe Visser, Mohammed Benzineb

Svar_1: My first choice is Case 2: Digital consent solution for Dalarna University. I chose this case because it's a real problem with a clear solution. Right now the university handles consent with paper forms, which is slow and outdated. I want to build something that actually gets used and makes a difference. The project is also a good fit for me. It's not too big or too vague – I know what needs to be built and can work through it step by step. I'll get to work with both frontend and backend, plus handle the database. It also lets me practice skills I'll need after graduation: building a complete web application from start to finish, thinking about user experience, and handling data securely.
Svar_2: My second choice is Case 6: Automation of student leave of absence applications. I like this case because it's more about analysis and investigation than coding. The task is to understand the current process, look at legal requirements, and propose how it could be automated – not necessarily build the whole system. That fits well with how I prefer to work. I enjoy understanding problems, researching constraints, and writing recommendations. This project lets me do exactly that. It's also a real problem with clear data: over 200 cases handled manually each year. If I can identify which cases can be automated and how, that would save staff a lot of time. The flexibility is a plus too. The project can focus on analysis and a written proposal, which feels realistic and achievable.
Svar_3: My third choice is Case 8: OAuth-based authentication for Protoduck. I chose this as my third option because it's a clear and focused problem. The system already exists – it just needs secure login to go online. There's no guessing what needs to be done. Even though this case involves more coding than I prefer, I like that the scope is small and well-defined. It's not about building a whole application, just adding one specific feature. It's also a practical skill to learn. OAuth is used almost everywhere, so understanding how it works could be useful later, even if I'm not mainly a developer.
Svar_4: Yes, I would prefer to work with Abdelnasser Hussein and Kendal Acun. The main reason is practical – our schedules work well together. We all have jobs and other commitments outside of school, and our availability matches up. I've been in groups before where coordinating times was a real struggle. It slowed everything down and made the work harder than it needed to be. With Abdelnasser and Kendal, I know we can actually meet and get things done without constant scheduling conflicts.
Svar_5: No, there's no one I don't want to work with. My preference for Abdelnasser and Kendal is mainly about practical scheduling, not about avoiding anyone else.

Svar_1: My first choice is Case No. 2: Digital consent solution for use of photos and media. I find this case interesting because it solves a very practical and everyday problem in a more modern and sustainable way. Replacing paper forms with a simple digital solution feels meaningful and relevant. I also like that the case focuses on usability, trust, and clear communication with users, while still involving important aspects such as data handling and consent management. Overall, it feels like a realistic project that I can both learn a lot from and contribute to.
Svar_2: My second choice is Case No. 6: Automation of student leave of absence applications. I find this case interesting because it focuses on improving an existing administrative process and making it more efficient. Automating clearly approvable cases would save time for both staff and students, which feels meaningful and practical.
Svar_3: My third choice is Case No. 8: OAuth-based authentication for an inventory system. I am interested in this case because it focuses on a very concrete and useful problem, making an existing system secure and ready to be published online. I find authentication and security important and interesting areas.
Svar_4: Lawin Akgul and Abdelnasser Hussein.
Svar_5: No, there is no one in particular that I would not want to work with. However, I do not have a very flexible schedule, which can sometimes make coordination and meeting times more challenging. Therefore, I would preferably like to work with Lawin Akgul and Abdelnasser Hussein, as I know we have similar schedules, which would allow us to work together more efficiently and get the most out of everything as a team.

This project’s focus on improving object-tracking accuracy in 360-degree video will provide a strong foundation for my master’s thesis, which I am scheduled to begin immediately following this course.
Svar_2: As a Data Science master’s student, I am interested in Case No. 11 because it perfectly bridges the gap between data engineering and warehousing. I am eager to apply my skills to replace manual database scripts with a more efficient, automated API-based collector. This project provides the exact technical foundation I need to transition into a Data Engineer role after my studies.
